hours_text:
**Admission**  
Pay from Your Heart - Whether it's one penny or one hundred dollars, you pick your admission fee to BMoCA!

Please note: Cash, Cards & Apple Pay are accepted. There is a $1 minimum charge on credit cards.

**Parking**  
Metered parking is available on 13th & 14th Streets and runs $1.50-$3 per hour during weekdays, 9am - 7pm. Parking is free on Saturdays and Sundays. 13th Street is closed on Saturdays and Wednesdays during Farmers Market Season (April-November) for the Boulder Farmers Market. There is additional parking at One Boulder Plaza (between Canyon & Walnut on 13th).

**Public Transportation**  
The RTD has bus routes ([Route 204](https://app.rtd-denver.com/route/204/schedule) \- Table Mesa/Moorhead/North 19th and [SKIP](https://app.rtd-denver.com/route/SKIP/schedule)) that run along Broadway, which is one block away from the museum. Standard 3 hour pass is $2.75.

**Museum & Store Hours  
**Tuesday – Sunday: 11am - 5pm

Open at 9am Saturdays and until 7:30pm Wednesdays during Farmers Market Season!

We are closed on Thanksgiving Day, Christmas Day and New Year’s Day.

**Administrative Hours**  
Monday — Friday: 9am — 5pm

1750 13th Street  
Boulder, Colorado 80302

**Hours**  
Tuesday–Sunday  
11am–5pm, Closed Mondays  
  
303.443.2122  
visitorservices@bmoca.org

collections_text:
## Closed for installation of Spring Exhibition, opening January 29, 2026

[ More info ](/2026/yes-and-at-bmoca)

[ ](/yaw-young-artists-at-work-summer-camps)

### YAW School Days Off Art Camps

**Upcoming dates are February 16 & 17, 2026**.

Young Artists at Work (YAW) day camps offer a dynamic and inspiring day of artistic expression, where campers explore artists and art materials, and have fun together in an art museum setting!

[ Learn more ](/yaw-young-artists-at-work-summer-camps)

[ ](/curatorial-services-main)

BMoCA has presented innovative works of contemporary art in Boulder and Denver Metro Area for over 50 years. Well known for our flagship exhibitions, we also have a depth of experience curating spaces beyond the museum’s galleries, like libraries and community spaces.

### Curatorial Services
